data.title: Variables window is not updated when executing code in the "Debug Console"

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10, Build 14393.953

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Debug the following code
```let notRefreshed = "0";```
2. The variable "notRefreshed" should appear in the "Variables" console
3. Execute the following in the debug Console
```notRefreshed = "1";```

Actual Result:
The variable will be updated, but it won't show as updated in the "Variables" window of VSCode. If you step to the next instruction, you'll see the variable updated.

data.title: Scrolling position is not synchronising in node loaded scripts
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
Ref: #23283

- VSCode Version: 1.11.0
- OS Version: Win10
- Node Protocol: inspect and legacy

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Initiate remote debugging session.
2. Set a breakpoint in any of the <node_internals> file and hit it. 
3. Close the file without any scrolling after the breakpoint was hit.
4. Open the same script via `Debug: Open Loaded Script`. 

The opened script is scrolled to the top, whereas expected to scrolled to the same line, where it stayed after step 3.

Hitting the breakpoint, then navigating to another file and back also resets the scrolling position.

data.title: Provide some clue why debug actions are no-ops most of the time

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
testing #21633:

Since all actions in the debug menu are now always available (and enabled), it is not really clear what happens if they are executed at any time (or why they are not doing anything most of the time).

I wonder whether we should give the user some clue why most of them have no effect if no debug session is running.

Example: on macOS you hear a sound ("boing") if you type a keyboard shortcut but nobody listens or because the action is disabled. So you get a hint that something is wrong. Previous versions of macOS had even an escalation mechanism: if you had produced the "boing" two times in a row an alert would popup and explain the problem.

data.title: Proposed Task Api Feedback
data.body:
re #23280

* [x] The `TaskSet` has two optional arrays allowing to list id of task that are test-tasks or build-tasks. While it's not entirely clear to me what that means it is somewhat cumbersome to repeat the ids there again, esp if I have created them programmatically. Chances are high I will add some sort of properly on my tasks for that and therefore I'd propose we make the API like that. Something like `[ShellTask|ProcessTask]#kind` which is an enum spelling out different task kinds
* [x] Var-args like this `constructor(name: string, commandLine: string, ...problemMatchers: ProblemMatcher[]);` look nice but put in a corner wrt to evolving the API. You won't be able to add another parameter easily 
* [ ] There is `Task#identifier` but there is no obvious reason why. It seems to be an internal property or does it surface in the UI in some form?

data.title: Switch SCM Provider action is not consistent when triggered with and without workspace
data.body:
Testing #23311 

- Register a sample scm provider extension
- Open VS Code with above extension on no-workspace
- Run the command `SCM: Switch SCM Provider`
- You see only the sample SCM Provider from above extension

- Open VS Code with above extension on a workspace
- Run the command `SCM: Switch SCM Provider`
- You see two providers Git and provider from above extension

It should either show both or none.

data.title: CodeAction lightbulb gets stuck on the wrong document if showTextDocument is used in the code action.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2 and 1.11.0
- OS Version: All

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the C++ (cpptools) extension or some other extension that has a code action that calls showTextDocument.
2. Do command C/Cpp: Edit Configurations to cause the c_cpp_properties.json file to be created/opened. With other extensions, you need to open the target file of the showTextDocument for the code action.
3. Open a C/C++ file that has text #include "nonExistantFile" on lines 1-36 (or the file that is the source of the code action).
4. Click on the code action lightbulb for the #include line and select "Add include path to settings", which will cause an open/ShowTextDocument to occur.

Bug: The code action lightbulb appears on the target document (c_cpp_properties.json) on the same line as the source document. Let me know if you guys suggest some workaround, such as closing the document before showing it. The bug doesn't repro if the target file is dirty (or not open previously). The lightbulb goes away after switching documents.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19859882/24409829/36493af0-1386-11e7-9b0b-f72479ddb0d7.png)

data.title: contextKey and stateContextKey for an SCM Provider?
data.body:
Testing #23311 

SCM Provider has `contextKey` and `stateContextKey`. `contextKey` is always same (eg: `git`) for  a given SCM provider. For all actions, extension should provide `scmProvider=='git'` in when context. Is there any option to make it simpler 
- if this when clause `scmProvider=='git'` is always needed, can we make it computed?
- Not sure about what are the generic use cases for providing state context key?

2. It should respect the selection and allow users to stage only parts of that block

data.title: Menu item extensions for scm/resource and scm/resourceGroup locations are not inline with others
data.body:
Testing #23311

In order to show actions for scm resources or scm resource groups, extension should register to following menu locations
- `scm/resource/context`
- `scm/resourceGroup/context`

Above locations implies context menu because existing menu extension points like `editor/title/context`, `explorer/context` `editor/context` shows actions in their context menus.

So, we should change the ids not to mention context.

data.body:

This setting should be `true` by default, why isn't it?

As I open files from https://github.com/joaomoreno/encodings, most of them appear broken in our default state. Only by setting it to true do the files start making sense.
